channel.title: Jalopnik
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: This Is What A Celebrity Face-Morphing Site Does To Cars
item.description:
You know those stupid sites that claim to let you see what your love-child with Miley Cyrus or Tyne Daly or Merlin Olsen would look like? Or visualize the offspring of Beyonce and Chris Elliott? Of course you don't; they're stupid. Still, I got the equally stupid idea to see what these face-morphing sites would do with cars.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jason Torchinsky

item.title: Customizable, Solar Powered E-Ink Parking Signs Need To Happen
item.description:
The comments in the most ridiculous parking sign story got me thinking, which is never a good thing. Why are we stuck with static signs stacked end-on-end? What if these signs could change throughout the day depending on the time and regulations? Enter the solar powered e-ink display.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Damon Lavrinc

item.title: Vomiting Dragsters And Screaming Choirs Are America's Best Thing Ever
item.description:
If America contributes nothing of culture to the world, not rock music, not rap music, not cheeseburgers, not Jackson Pollock paintings, let it keep contributing these. These glorious, wonderful videos of drag racing in slow motion, that feature fuel spilling out like so much mechanical puke.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Michael Ballaban

item.title: Alfa Gives Us The Official Line On What's Up With Their Snake Logo
item.description:
Yesterday, I did some digging into the meaning behind one of the most distinctive and puzzling car maker logos around: the Alfa Romeo 'dragon-eating-a-dude' crest. I was curious about Alfa's official company line on the badge, and, happily, they told me.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jason Torchinsky

item.title: Someone Please Save This 1976 Celica GT
item.description:
Japanese sports cars from the 70's look to be the next collector market. I'm partial to the classic Celica as it has the JDM goodness combined with some pony-car attitude. This particular Celica on Craigslist could use a good home and a lot of adhesive remover.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tom McParland on Car Buying, shared by Jason Torchinsky to Jalopnik

item.title: Volvo Says This Is The Safest SUV Money Can Buy
item.description:
Minus the armored ones. Still, the Swedish say six years from now, nobody should get killed or seriously injured in a new Volvo . Is that even possible?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Máté Petrány on Truck Yeah, shared by Travis Okulski to Jalopnik

item.title: Zelda, Animal Crossing Coming To Mario Kart 8 [UPDATE: Prices]
item.description:
Didn't like that stupid Mercedes DLC for Mario Kart 8? Please understand. Nintendo had something cooler coming later.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett on Kotaku, shared by Travis Okulski to Jalopnik

item.title: ​The Guy That Crashed A Veyron Into A Lake Pleads Guilty, Faces 20 Years
item.description:
Andy House, the exotic car salvage yard owner that crashed his Bugatti Veyron into a Texas lake , has pled guilty to wire mail fraud in federal court, and now he's facing up to 20 years in prison for what basically amounts to insurance fraud.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Damon Lavrinc

item.title: Fuck It, New York City Should Go Back To The Checker Cab
item.description:
It's been fifteen years since the last Checker cab operated in New York City, and I think the joke has gone on long enough. I don't care how it's going to be done, but the Checker cab should come back in service.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Raphael Orlove

item.title: ​Pro Tip: Don't Overpack When Driving A Porsche 918 Spyder
item.description:
If you're dropping the better part of a million bucks on Porsche's hybrid supercar, adding another $20k to the sticker for a set of custom-fit luggage seems like a no-brainer. And speaking of no-brainers…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Damon Lavrinc

item.title: Deadspin ESPN Reports On Who Is And Isn't Showering With Michael Sam | Gizmodo The Ultimate Breakdow
item.description:
Deadspin ESPN Reports On Who Is And Isn't Showering With Michael Sam | Gizmodo The Ultimate Breakdown of How People Watch Porn Online | Jezebel Dear White People, You Need More Black Friends | Kotaku Maybe The N64 Rainbow Road Isn't As Great As We All Remember | Kinja Popular Posts

item.dc:creator: Jane-Claire Quigley on Kinja Roundup, shared by Travis Okulski to Jalopnik

item.title: How Ford Squeezed Every Drop Of Aerodynamics Out Of The 2015 F-150
item.description:
The 2015 Ford F-150 is easily the angriest and boxiest rendition of the truck in its history, but believe it or not it's also the most aerodynamic. Scraping down as much wind resistance as possible was done by taking advantage of details where air could be directed.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Andrew P Collins on Truck Yeah, shared by Travis Okulski to Jalopnik

item.title: There's Still Time To Sign This Petition To Kill The 25-Year Import Ban
item.description:
Online petitions to the White House rarely meet the goal needed to get a response. But the petition to kill the 25-year import ban has 55,000 signatures. That means it needs just 45,000 more. Let's get it done.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Travis Okulski

item.title: More Proof Uber Fights Dirty Against the Competition
item.description:
When you have an unapologetic asshole for a CEO, your company does things like this: Uber is conducting a full-blown street campaign to destroy Lyft using deceptive tactics, The Verge reports. This is what "disruption" really looks like.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Sam Biddle on Valleywag, shared by Damon Lavrinc to Jalopnik

item.title: Malaysia Airlines Is Hemorrhaging Money, Flying Nearly Empty Planes
item.description:
Malaysia Airlines is still flying through turbulent skies, and reeling from two tragic plane crashes within a span of only 4.5 months. Amid investigations of both crashes and talks of privatization, its own passengers are sharing evidence of how the airline is failing to attract business.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Paul Thompson on flightclub, shared by Travis Okulski to Jalopnik

item.title: Here's What It Feels Like When Your Lamborghini Is Impounded
item.description:
Working really hard to buy your childhood dream car is awesome. The police putting said dream car on a truck and taking it away from you is significantly less awesome. Friend of Jalopnik Rob Dahm recently had his 2001 Diablo taken away by the nice people of law enforcement, and here's how he handled it.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tavarish, Car Buying

item.title: Watch This Dual Subaru Nurburgring Near-Miss And Cry
item.description:
Just go to about 1:30 in to watch two guys nearly destroy their boy-racer dreams when a sudden caution flag makes them hit the brakes.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Michael Ballaban

item.title: Celebratory Gunfire May Be A Tradition, But This Is Terrifying
item.description:
In some places around the globe, including the Middle East, Afghanistan, some parts of the Balkans, India and Latin America, and probably Texas, firing into the air may be a celebratory tradition, but it can also be deadly. For instance, after the Gulf War, there were 20 deaths from falling bullets fired in celebration in Kuwait alone.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tyler Rogoway on foxtrotalpha, shared by Travis Okulski to Jalopnik

item.title: Horny Giraffe Really Loves The BMW GS
item.description:
The beauty of the adventure bike is the opportunity to travel off the beaten path, explore the unpaved world, and commune with nature. But nature poses certain risks. Among them: randy giraffes.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Damon Lavrinc on lanesplitter, shared by Jason Torchinsky to Jalopnik

item.title: This Renault LeCar Van Is The Tiny French Sex Van You Deserve
item.description:
The biggest problem with Le Car ownership has always been dealing with all the increased sexual appeal one gets when owning the car. Sex in the back of the conventional Le Car is usually too cramped and too exposed via those large windows. If only there was a solution! Guess what, pals: there is.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jason Torchinsky

item.title: Flying On The New Goodyear Zeppelin Is Unlike All Other Flying
item.description:
I've flown on many aircraft types, from modern widebody jets to vintage turboprops, helicopters and even a military transport plane. But of those hundreds of flights, nothing I've flown on in the past compares to the Zeppelin LZ N07-101 I flew on Saturday. It's Goodyear's newest airship, dubbed Wingfoot One.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Paul Thompson, Flight Club

item.title: Horse and Buggy Robbed by Masked Gunmen
item.description:
A group of Amish riding in a horse and buggy along a East Lampeter Township, Penn. road were robbed at gunpoint by a man in a mask. The robber apparently drove up to the horse and buggy in a white minivan, swerving into the buggy's lane to force it to stop, got out, and demanded the wallets of all three people inside.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Aleksander Chan on Gawker, shared by Raphael Orlove to Jalopnik

item.title: New-Car Smell Is Overrated
item.description:

item.title: 2015 Land Rover Discovery Sport Accidentally Released As A Toy
item.description:
This picture of two die-cast SUVs that look exactly like the 2015 Land Rover Discovery Sport have been circulating around the internet for the past 24 hours or so. The new Freelander/LR2 replacement isn't meant to be revealed until September 2nd, but it seems we're getting a small-scale sneak peek right here.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Andrew P Collins on Truck Yeah, shared by Travis Okulski to Jalopnik
